text.tspan: Slope (m) is a value that describes
the steepness or flatness of a line.
Applying the same procedure to compass heading readings requires a small
change as the measurements are not arranged in the same manner as above.
We must calculate h1c from h1.
This process of calculating h1c from h1 is not complex but unnecessary.
We can simply us h1 in the calculation but then take the inverse of the resulting slope:
The reason for this is the following:
The tangent rule uses the angle between the hypotenuse and adjacent sides and the
ratio of the opposite and adjacent sides.
Here are some examples of slope values at 10 degree increments. Note that they
